verses.verse: In the year<WH8141> that king<WH4428> Uzziah<WH5818> died<WH4194> I saw<WH7200> also<WH853> the Lord<WH136> sitting<WH3427> upon a throne<WH3678>, high<WH7311> and lifted up<WH5375>, and his train<WH7757> filled<WH4392> the temple<WH1964>.

Above<WH4605> it stood<WH5975> the seraphims<WH8314>: each one<WH259> had six<WH8337> wings<WH3671>; with two<WH8147> he covered<WH3680> his face<WH6440>, and with two<WH8147> he covered<WH3680> his feet<WH7272>, and with two<WH8147> he did fly<WH5774>.
And one cried<WH7121> unto another<WH559>, and said, Holy<WH6918>, holy<WH6918>, holy<WH6918>, is the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>: the whole earth<WH776> is full<WH4393> of his glory<WH3519>.
And the posts<WH520> of the door<WH5592> moved<WH5128> at the voice<WH6963> of him that cried<WH7121>, and the house<WH1004> was filled<WH4390> with smoke<WH6227>.

Then said<WH559> I<WH188>, Woe is me<WH1820>! for I am undone; because I am a man<WH376> of unclean<WH2931> lips<WH8193>, and I live<WH3427> in the midst<WH8432> of a people<WH5971> of unclean<WH2931> lips<WH8193>: for my eyes<WH5869> have seen<WH7200> the King<WH4428>, the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>.
Then flew<WH5774> one<WH259> of the seraphims<WH8314> unto me<WH7531>, having a live coal in his hand<WH3027>, which he had taken<WH3947> with the tongs<WH4457> from off the altar<WH4196>:

And he laid<WH5060> it upon my mouth<WH6310>, and said<WH559>, Behold<WH5060>, this has touched your lips<WH8193>; and your iniquity<WH5771> is taken away<WH5493>, and your sin<WH2403> purged<WH3722>.
Also I heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of the Lord<WH136>, saying<WH559>, Whom shall I send<WH7971>, and who will go<WH3212> for us<WH559>? Then said I<WH7971>, Here am I; send me.
And he said<WH559>, Go<WH3212>, and tell<WH559> this people<WH5971>, Hear<WH8085> you indeed<WH8085>, but understand<WH995> not<WH7200>; and see you indeed<WH7200>, but perceive not<WH3045>.

Make the heart<WH3820> of this people<WH5971> fat<WH8080>, and make their ears<WH241> heavy<WH3513>, and shut<WH8173> their eyes<WH5869>; lest they see<WH7200> with their eyes<WH5869>, and hear<WH8085> with their ears<WH241>, and understand<WH995> with their heart<WH3824>, and convert<WH7725>, and be healed<WH7495>.

Then said<WH559> I<WH136>, Lord, how long<WH559>? And he answered, Until the cities<WH5892> be wasted<WH7582> without inhabitant<WH3427>, and the houses<WH1004> without man<WH120>, and the land<WH127> be utterly<WH8077> desolate<WH7582>,
And the Lord<WH3068> have removed<WH7368> men<WH120> far away<WH7368>, and there be a great<WH7227> forsaking<WH5805> in the midst<WH7130> of the land<WH776>.

But yet in it shall be a tenth<WH6224>, and it shall return<WH7725>, and shall be eaten<WH1197>: as a teil tree<WH424>, and as a oak<WH437>, whose substance<WH4678> is in them<WH7995>, when they cast their leaves<WH6944>: so the holy seed<WH2233> shall be the substance there<WH4678>.
